snippet: Jeremy Hunt, the culture minister, told a British panel that he had been personally sympathetic to a bid by Rupert Murdoch to take over British Sky Broadcasting but that he did not act with any favorable bias.
abstract: Britain's Culture Min Jeremy Hunt testifies at a judicial inquiry into the British media that he had been personally sympathetic to a bid by Rupert Murdoch to take over British Sky Broadcasting, Britain’s most lucrative pay-television network, but that he did not act with improper bias.

byline.original: By JOHN F. BURNS and RAVI SOMAIYA
byline.contributor: Ravi Somaiya contributed reporting from London.

lead_paragraph: Jeremy Hunt, the culture minister, told a British panel that he had been personally sympathetic to a bid by Rupert Murdoch to take over British Sky Broadcasting but that he did not act with any favorable bias.

headline.seo: Culture Minister Questioned in British Hacking Scandal
headline.main: British Minister Concedes Sympathy to Murdoch TV Bid
headline.print_headline: Official Says He Set Aside His Partiality To Murdochs

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Wiretapping and Other Eavesdropping Devices and Methods
